text:
2. How do I set up literate programming with org-mode and Julia?
- I installed emacs-jupyter on Doom and added the code snippet (org-babel-do-load-languages ...) into my config.el but I get the following errors:
    - 1) When starting a Julia kernel, I get "Requesting kernel info..." that ends with "Kernel did not respond to kernel-info request"
    - 2) When trying out a jupyter-julia org-mode code block, I get "No org-babel-execute function for jupyter-julia!"
- Does emacs-jupyter conflict with julia-repl?

elements.text:
2. How do I set up literate programming with org-mode and Julia?
- I installed emacs-jupyter on Doom and added the code snippet (org-babel-do-load-languages ...) into my config.el but I get the following errors:
    - 1) When starting a Julia kernel, I get "Requesting kernel info..." that ends with "Kernel did not respond to kernel-info request"
    - 2) When trying out a jupyter-julia org-mode code block, I get "No org-babel-execute function for jupyter-julia!"
- Does emacs-jupyter conflict with julia-repl?

text: it’s funny because i remember that exact error, but I don’t know what exactly I did (if anything) that ended up fixing it.

elements.text: it’s funny because i remember that exact error, but I don’t know what exactly I did (if anything) that ended up fixing it.

text: I don’t believe that the packages conflict - was actually just able to get a julia babel source to plot something today

elements.text: I don’t believe that the packages conflict - was actually just able to get a julia babel source to plot something today

text:
looking through my init.el file, one thing that looks a little different is the additions
```       (org               ; organize your plain life in plain text
        +jupyter
        +roam)```
though I can’t remember if that is a default setting as well..

elements.text: looking through my init.el file, one thing that looks a little different is the additions

(org               ; organize your plain life in plain text
        +jupyter
        +roam)
though I can’t remember if that is a default setting as well..

text: That semi worked!! Thank you <@U019VMUTVC1>! Added +jupyter to org stopped the "No org-babel-execute function for jupyter-julia!" (and similar for jupyter-python)

elements.text: ! Added +jupyter to org stopped the "No org-babel-execute function for jupyter-julia!" (and similar for jupyter-python)

text: I'm not sure what the +jupyter thing does with Doom Emacs internally, but happy that it works!

elements.text: I'm not sure what the +jupyter thing does with Doom Emacs internally, but happy that it works!

text: Now I still get an error when I try running a jupyter-julia source block, it tries to start a julia-1.5 kernel process, but still gets stuck at "Requesting kernel info..." and ends with "Kernel did not respond to kernel-info request"

elements.text: Now I still get an error when I try running a jupyter-julia source block, it tries to start a julia-1.5 kernel process, but still gets stuck at "Requesting kernel info..." and ends with "Kernel did not respond to kernel-info request"

text: Tears of joy. I got it to work now!! I just had to `] add IJulia` (I did it from terminal outside of Emacs), and now the kernel works! So now I can open up the jupyter repl, but I can also run org-mode jupyter source blocks! I followed this person's instructions <https://discourse.julialang.org/t/jupyter-integration-with-emacs/21496/4> (<@UPRKNS675> Thank you!!)

attachments.title: Jupyter integration with emacs
attachments.text: This is seriously cool. Anyone care to share their .emacs file for using this to provide interaction with .jl files?
